results.title: Impunidad
results.creator_credit: Cam Productions, SBS-TV, Film Victoria and Helen Gaynor
results.brief_description: Impunidad, impunity n. “exemption from punishment”. In 1954 a CIA-backed military coup toppled the democratic government in Guatemala allowing full control by the Army over the citizens of Guatemala. During the 1960’s and 1970’s a guerilla movement established itself throughout large areas of the country-side, and in the late 70’s the Army took on a “scorched earth policy” destroying 440 villages, with 100,000 civilians murdered and 45,000 missing. In a land shrouded in silence where 2.1% of the population own 72% of arable land, 86% live in poverty and 1,000,000 are internally displaced, Australian filmmaker, Helen Gaynor, worked undercover to reveal the continuing violence between the armed forces and the indigenous peoples, the terror and corruption which still allows the army to continue acting with impunity. 65% of the 10 million population are indigenous Mayan Indians, and despite 500 years of oppression, many facets of their culture survives. Though fewer in number, the disappearances, torture and massacres are still occurring today. Narrated by Jenny Seedsman In English and Spanish with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cam Productions, SBS-TV, Film Victoria and Helen Gaynor

results.title: Impudence does not pay
results.creator_credit: Progress Film and Bruno I. Botige
results.brief_description: A black and white silhouette film for children telling the story of a gorilla who steals his hunter’s rifle and helmet, after an exciting episode, and then taunts the other animals, even riding on a lion’s back. Finally they can bear it no longer and toss him from his hammock into the open jaws of a crocodile Music only

results.title: Improvised drama. No.2
results.brief_description: John Hodgson, Principal Drama Lecturer at Bretton Hall College of Education continues his drama lesson with the third year secondary class, and two teachers demonstrate other uses of improvised drama.

results.title: Improvised drama. No.1
results.brief_description: An inquiry into the value to the English teacher of improvised drama in the classroom. Shows an unrehearsed drama lesson with a class of third year secondary students, and work with a class of fourteen year old boys.

results.title: Improving your posture
results.brief_description: Demonstrates several posture difficulties and shows various corrective exercises. Explains the skeletal and muscular systems and shows how bad posture affects health, comfort and appearance.

results.title: Impromptu
results.creator_credit: Sovereign Pictures, Governor Productions, Les Films Ariane, Stuart Oken, Daniel A. Sherkow and James Lapine
results.brief_description: Two lovers could never be more different than the cross-dressing, cigar-smoking writer George Sand (Judy Davis) and the frail, romantic Frederic Chopin (Hugh Grant). The greatest creative minds of all time - including Liszt (Julian Sands), Delacroix (Ralph Brown) and de Musset (Mandy Patinkin) come together for one wild fortnight. The lustful Marie d’Agoult (Bernadette Peters) decides to amuse herself and with her mischievous scheming there is no telling who will end up with who! The outcome is scandalous even by today’s standards - an outrageous sex farce that portrays the greatest geniuses with sexual appetites as powerful as their creative fervour. Co-starring Georges Corraface, Anton Rodgers and Emma Thompson.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.brief_description: A social and philosophical fable about a little boy who has a plank fastened to his back. The day it is taken off is a day of great relief. The boy then discovers that his body bears the mark of a shoe sole and heel.

results.title: Imprint = L'Empreinte
results.creator_credit: International Film Promotions, Jacques Armand Cardon and Henri Lacam
results.brief_description: Animated philosophical tale about the moulding of children into a social pattern. Futuristic piece which suggests that society will consist of two classes - the rulers and the ruled. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Impressions of Expo '67
results.brief_description: An invitation to Canada that all will want to see and many will wish to accept, presented in impressions of Expo 67 and of Montreal, the host city, at the liveliest and most exciting moment in its history.
